definition: to conceive a scheme/to devise a plan

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: He buy the car on the spur of the moment.
sentences.chinese: 他临时起意买了一辆车。

sentences.english: As tokens of my gratitude I offered him jokes that came to me on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 我以临时起意的笑话献给他，作为我感恩的表达。

sentences.english: And the woman said, Wherefore then hast thou thought such a thing against the people of God?
sentences.chinese: 妇人说，王为何也起意要害神的民呢。

sentences.english: Expression is very important, temporarily entertaining thoughts of expression.
sentences.chinese: 表情很重要，临时起意的表情。

definition: lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
